page.title: 15HISTORY-E.WOODWARD,D.SPANNER
page.content: {THE CINDER HOUSE}IS ONE OF THE MORE INTERESTING AND HISTORICAL BUILDINGS IN WEST HALLAM.IT WAS BUILT IN 1833 AND WAS BUILT TO COMMEMORATE THE BIRTH OF SIR FRANCES NEWDIGATE'S SON.THE WALLS ARE 30 INCHES THICK AND IT IS MADE OUT OF CINDER.THEY GOT THE CLAY FROM MAPPERLEY PARK ESPECIALLY FOR THIS PURPOSE.THE HOUSE HAS A COTTAGE BY THE SIDE OF IT AND IN THE GARDEN IT HAS A WELL AND A COAL HOUSE WHICH ARE SUPPOSED TO BE HAUNTED.INSIDE THE HOUSE THE WALLS ARE MOSTLY WHITE AND THE CEILING IS BEAMED.THE BEDROOMS ARE SMALL AND THERE IS A LOW CEILING.{ THE {POTTERY}WAS FOUNDED IN THE EARLY '20'S AND WAS THEN KNOWN AS THE ART POTTERY AND EARTHENWARE COMPANY.TWO FAMOUS DESIGNS OF THIS POTTERY WERE THE WEST HALLAM SWALLOW AND THE WEST HALLAM RABBIT.NOW THE POTTERY IS REBUILT IT IS GOING TO BE USED AS A GARDEN CENTRE
